title: Ticket #2416: Remove support for antique Visual Studio C++
description:
Possible STUDENTTASK

We still have support for some very, very old versions of Visual Studio / Visual C++ scattered through our code. It's never used, there is a chance it's bitrotted, and it's bloat. Proposed:

  1. Identify a minimum version of Visual Studio to support. TJ is probably the best current resource. At a bare minimum, declare Visual Studio 6 dead.
  2. Given the previous, identify the associated _MSC_VER macro setting. (It's 1200 for Visual Studio 6)
  3. Search for all references to _MSC_VER in the code where it is being compared to a number. Skip cases simply checking for it existing.
  4. For each reference, if possible, simplify the test on the assumption that it will always be at least the minimum.
  5. Add a single check to ensure the minimum version, maybe in /src/condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core_main.cpp, something like: 
    #if _MSC_VER <= 1200
#    error A more modern version of Visual C++ is required.
#endif
